micwallace/reddinator,open,Video in WebView keeps playing after pressing home/power button,[],"Open a page with Youtube video. Start playing the video and leave the app by pressing home button (or lock screen or switch to another app), sound from video can still be heard in the background.
![screen shot 2018-04-12 at 1 11 52 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38213896/38657500-1b3f0be2-3e53-11e8-9cdd-34f675c6b5d9.png)
Screenshot of the page with video.
Should be fixed by pause webview explicitly."
micwallace/reddinator,open,ODS file on internal browser (docs.google.com),[],"When I swipe to see other columns on the sheet, I switch to comments tab"

micwallace/reddinator,closed,Support for F-Droid as an alternative to Google Play,[],"I'd like to see this up on F-Droid, there is a compiled version already there and I don't know if you're the one who requested that. But the version there seems to be one behind the one on Google Play store.  Version 3.21.2 instead of 3.21.3"

micwallace/reddinator,open,feature request: multi-account,[],"many reddit clients allow seamless switching between multiple accounts without logging out. reddinator should have that feature, too. "
micwallace/reddinator,open,stack widget refresh,[],"I'm loving the new stack widget, but when I refresh it doesn't go back to the first position in the list.
To further clarify, if I go down 5, refresh, I'm at the refreshed 5 which may be something new, there should be a way to quickly ascend to 1 either by refresh or possibly a new button..
micwallace/reddinator,closed,Fix buildscript repos,[],"`com.android.tools.build:gradle:2.2.2` is not available in mavenCentral, but only in jcenter."
micwallace/reddinator,closed,Fix viewing AboutDialog crash,[],"Issue #14
micwallace/reddinator,closed,Reddinator crashes when viewing AboutDialog,[],Latest build throws:
android.util.AndroidRuntimeException: requestFeature() must be called before adding content""
on attempt to view the ""about"" window. The source before last 2 commits works fine, so an error probably have been introduced within these.
Tested on Xperia J, Android 4.1.2 (API 16)
micwallace/reddinator,closed,[Bug] App always crashes when in the Theme Chooser,[],To reproduce this crash, the following steps were done:
- Launch the app -> Settings->Theme Manager.
- Add a new theme, touch back button twice.
Crashes every single time.
Added a video in case you wanted to have a look at it.
Additional info:
Installed from F-Droid.
Phone details:
Oneplus One aka Bacon aka A0001
Running Cyanogen OS 13.1 (Android 6.0.1)
If you need any other info, let me know.
[Reddinator_Crash_Vid_2_10_Jul_2016.zip](https://github.com/micwallace/reddinator/files/356374/Reddinator_Crash_Vid_2_10_Jul_2016.zip)
micwallace/reddinator,open,Widget looses position on some devices,[],Likely due to a new remote views factory being spawned.
micwallace/reddinator,closed,Self post content not loading,[],Self posts do not load content/comments view. May be caused by beta mobile view.
micwallace/reddinator,closed,Subreddit search not working using enter,[],Enter key linebreaks instead if searching in search input box.
micwallace/reddinator,closed,comment children not loading,[],Api call seems to be successful but no comment children inserted in dom.
micwallace/reddinator,closed,No comments view not hidden on first comment,[],When submitting the first comment for a post the no comments view is not hidden, or the comments pane not displayed.
micwallace/reddinator,closed,comment load more button, not reset after failure",[],"When loading more comments & the request fails, the buttons text & click event is not reset.
micwallace/reddinator,closed,Comment box unresponsive,[Label(name=""bug"")]","The keyboard refuses to type any text in the  comment box. I'm using the stock keyboard with a Samsung gt5380
micwallace/reddinator,closed,Add a fully transparent theme,[Label(name=""enhancement"")]","Will require new layout files
micwallace/reddinator,closed,Subreddit import only loads 25 subreddits,[Label(name=""bug"")]","This is a limitation in the API call. Increase length param in json request.

micwallace/reddinator,closed,Lots of little cleanup,[],So...I did make a couple of changes. Most of it is to make the code a bit more readable as well as bring it up to date with the gradle build system.

I do suggest, that if you accept the pull request, to make sure everything still works as you intend it to. I've been using my own build for the past couple of days and everything seems to be working fine. Let me know if you have any questions.
Thanks for the project, it's given me something to do the past couple of days :D
